data.title: Very Easy to Use and Reasonably Fast
data.body:
My old Samsung phone essentially stopped charging off its usual usb-c cord(s), so I thought that I'd try a wireless system. I wanted something small and easy and reasonably fast.

This Samsung unit does all three very well. Its about a 3" square and 3/4" tall, and has a usb-c cable to a small transformer. You put a phone on it, face up, and a small red light illuminates to let you know that the phone and charger has connected (some phones beep as well, as my newer Samsung does). Once you know where to took for the light (on the upper left ), its super easy to use. The light turns green when the phone is fully charged.

How one place a phone on it to connect varies a bit, but generally the middle of the phone should be more or less in the middle of the square. If that does work, shift it up or down a bit until the red light comes on.

Its is not as fast as the description makes it sound, but I keep it at my desk and just set the phone on it while I work. I have never timed it, but in an hour or two it always seems to be fully charted.

I had not realize how much I would enjoy not having to plug in wires every time that I charge the phone. If I had, I would have bought it a long time ago. (It did solve the charging problem with my old phone and works fine on the new one that I decided to purchase a few months later.) Easy Peasey.

data.title: Works great with my S22+
data.body:
I got this because the USB-C port on my S22+ was beginning to wear and not hold a tight connection. The Samsung charging pad is more expensive than some other pads available here, but I liked the concept of a built-in fan and the way that the phone and the pad appear to work together.

I've seen some comments here that the wireless charging is slower than wired. Well, that's just the nature of wireless charging. I've used wireless charging on some previous Samsung phones, so I wasn't surprised.

Some people have complained that the charger cuts out or that it is hard to place the phone to get charging to start. I experienced both problems when I was trying to place the phone so that the camera bump wasn't in contact with the charger. I stopped being concerned about that and just placed the phone squarely on the pad. Charging as been 100% reliable since then.

The charging process does generate heat, and excessive heat is bad for the battery. I found that my phone has an option for fast wireless charging. When I turned it off, it charged with just a bit of barely detectable warmth. As an added bonus, the fan in the charger base doesn't activate. Of course, there is a trade-off: charging is much slower. The phone charges at the rate of about 22%/hour. That may be unacceptable if it being charged during the day, but is more than sufficient for overnight charging.

data.title: Easy to use, just what I needed
data.body: A great charging station for two devices, Samsung S22+ and Galaxy watch 4, that offers fast charging in a convenient package. Just place your watch and phone in the designated areas to start the charging process. The watch area does not charge your phone as some people have tried in other reviews. I can't complain as this does exactly what I needed it to do. There are led lights next to each station that will glow red when charging and green when finished. There is a slight humming that comes from the fan but it is not really noticable unless you live in a quiet house. I have this sitting on my desk for work and am glad I don't have to go searching for a wire to plug my phone in. I just set it atop the charging pad and continue about my work day.

data.title: Works as intended
data.body:
TL;DR - Works as intended, but not for my use case.

I purchased this for my nightstand to charge my phone wirelessly at night. Unfortunately for this use case, it's pretty mediocre. You have to make sure the phone is perfectly centered and the surface is smooth, so the phone will slide in a random direction if you bump it. Overall, not a great "toss it and forget it" charger. I decided to pick up something that's more of a stand with wireless charging as that provides a better "cradled" experience.

PROS: It provides the advertised 15W wireless charging. You can get the full fast wireless charging out of your Galaxy device from this.

CONS: The top has a smooth surface and your phone is prone to sliding off center and stopping charging if you accidentally bump it.

data.title: Charges quickly and includes everything you need, including a wall adapter
data.body:
I bought this charger for $34, and it's a great value. It comes with a USB-C to USB-C cable and a 25w wall adapter, which is one of the main reasons I decided on this product. The wall adapter alone costs around $20 if you were to buy it on it's own. I also love that this is a duo pad and can charge my Galaxy watch and earbuds. Samsung single charge pads cost the same or sometimes even more than this duo charging pad, which makes this duo pad a great value. Why buy a single charge pad when you can get a duo pad for the same amount of money, or even less?

Another thing I love about this charger is the charging speed. It charges my phone quickly, even when I'm charging two things at once. I was initially concerned that the charging speed would slow down drastically when charging two items, but I've tested it and found that the charging speed barely slows down at all. When charging just my phone, I get about 11 watts of charging speed, this is through an otterbox defender case as well so that's pretty good. When I put my watch or earbuds on the other pad the charging speed of my phone drops only slightly to around 10 watts.

The second best feature is how compact it is. This charger takes up very little real estate of my desk and I appreciate that. The design is good, and I love that the charging indicator lights are in a spot where you can see them even when you have your phone charging. I have another Samsung single pad 15w wireless charger and it's annoying because when my phone is on it I can not see the charging indicator light. I will be returning the single charge pad now that I have this duo pad.

All-in-all, this is a great buy. I couldn't go back to charging via cable, wireless is too convenient. I haven't charged with a cable since the Galaxy s4. Every phone I've owned since then has only had the USB-C port used once or twice. Once when transitioning to my new phone I'll use a cable to transfer all my data as it's much faster than doing it wireless, and maybe once or twice I'll charge with a cable if a wireless charging pad isn't available for whatever reason.

Do your phone a favor and go wireless.

data.title: Excellent value, comes with the AC adapter and charges most phones
data.body:
This was a great value, it came with the AC adapter and USB-C cable
It works with Samsung and Apple phones (along with lots of others) and will charge your watch or earbuds as well.

I've bought several of these and they are by far the best I have found for the money.

data.title: Very convenient, saves desk space
data.body:
I have a "charging closet" for most of my devices. But I didn't want to keep my phone, watch, and earbuds in that closet, because those devices see the most use. I have:
Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 Classic
Samsung S21 Ultra with Otterbox Symmetry case
Samsung Buds 2

Not relevant to this review, but I'm quite happy with this combination of devices.

I am using the standard watch band that came with the watch. I have been considering getting the Spigen Rugged Armor Pro, but I know that if I do that, I won't be able to charge the watch on this charger. As things are now, however, I've put away the original charger for the watch. This one is fine. I especially like that if you slide the watch around, the built in magnet helps you find the sweet spot for charging. I'm not unhappy with the charging speed compared to the original charger.

I usually position the earbuds case directly in the horizontal / vertical center of the charger. I do not find it difficult to locate the charging coil, and the speed of charging seems fine to me.

The most difficult part for me is putting my phone on the left edge of the charger. Since I have it in the Otterbox case, it doesn't charge as quickly as it could, and for whatever reason I sometimes have to fumle around until the charger lights up, telling me I've placed the phone correctly. I should note, however, that it does say "fast charging" on the phone when I get the correct spot. It's a little harder than I like to position it perfectly, but I feel this is a quibble. Also, it definitely charges more slowly than via the wire, but this is to be expected.

The main use case for me, which is to be able to charge these three devices at the same time, on a single dedicated spot on my desk, is served perfectly by this device. I've only had it for a short time (several weeks) as of this writing, but I'm quite happy with my purchase.

UPDATE: Even without a case, my S21 Ultra charges very slowly, and it doesn't even meet its own estimate for when the charging will be complete. I'm still trying to figure out if the problem is my phone, the charger, or the charging brick. But the Buds 2 and the Watch both charge as expected.

UPDATE 2: Several months later. I still like it. I have found that it's a bit finicky finding the sweet spot for the phone on the left side, so I'm now using it in the center position, and because there's a wire coming out the back, it's easier to find the spot. I'm using the left position for the earbuds. I am using the Otterbox Defender, and the phone (S21 Ultra) charges fine there.

data.title: Pretty Good Wireless Charger
data.body: Overall this is a good wireless charger. It is fantastic and fast and charging my watch and buds. It struggles to charge my phone, however. I have an S23, and it will not charge it above 92%. I have to plug it in to get to 100% and it takes a long time to charge it wirelessly. That being said it does the job and will continue using it. It is horrible for travel, however, It is long and bulky so it is best used at home. However, I still use it for travel because it does save you having to pack 3 different cords. Overall, 4/5 and would recommend for Samsung users.

data.title: Smart choice for the S24 series, especially the S24 Ultra
data.body:
The only wireless charger that delivers as promised. I've gone through quite a few wireless Qi chargers hoping to find one that hits the 15W fast charging and I've been disappointed. It's a chore trying to find the truth amidst all the false advertising on many of these products claiming Qi and Qi2 certifications and 15W fast charging. I've purchased and returned too many fake ones. The Samsung single pad, along with this Duo pad, deliver the full 15W plus some. I've hit nearly 20W at times. The Duo is fantastic. The built-in fan is a nice bonus. Stay away from the Trio, since it drops to max. 9W delivery, unless you need to charge 3 devices at once. This Duo wireless charger is my go-to most of the time, since the charging is fast enough for my needs, and I find myself bypassing the 45W of the wall adapter. By the way, get the Anker 313 USB-C 45W wall adapter. It is terrific. Trust me. Countless failed tries until finally purchasing the one I can recommend... Just get the Single or the Duo. Done.

Update: I'm testing this charger while using my Supcase UB Pro which is a rugged, thick protective case. I'm finding approx. a 5% to 10% drop in charging speeds. Wattage is dropping from approx. 19W to 18W peak. This is excellent. I'm totally satisfied with the performance of this charger.

data.title: Not perfect, but still solid.
data.body:
Wireless charging for phones is always a bit finicky, but this seems to be a fairly good charger.
Pros: It actually couples well, and I can use my Galaxy S20 while charging and still have battery level go up. I use plastic case with bezel and a steel plate at the bottom for car mounts, and it still connects well. Once the phone accepts charging, the link is pretty stable, and doesn't drop without moving the phone a fair amount.
Cons: This charger is picky about your USB-C power source. It has to support 9V and the correct protocol. If the light just gives double-red or yellow flashes, pick a new source. Only one of the C ports on my Shargeek Storm2 is supported. A small power bank and generic wall charger I had didn't work.
With some phones, at some battery level ranges, it makes a distinct whining sound. It's not noticable through headphones, and is quiter than my computer's fans, but it may be annoying at a quiet desk.

Overall, good performance that outweighs its issues.

data.title: does indeed charge "super" fast
data.body: So with a Samsung Galaxy S24, this is the fastest wireless charger I've been able to test using the Ampere app. With this samsung charger and the brick that comes with it(tried other bricks, even 65W to 100W ones, couldn't get max speed), I'm able to hit 2500mA in Ampere. All the other "15W" qi chargers I've tested, even the actively cooled ones, won't get past 1500mA in Ampere. My understanding that a 15W or 10W or 7.5W qi charger delivers that much wattage to the phone but that doesn't necessarily mean the phone charges at that rate, because running the app and having the screen on and all that uses power. I knocked off one star because this charger is very finicky about phone placement, and it has very little tolerance for misaligned phones.

data.title: Works with Otterbox Defender Cases!
data.body: Bought this for my desk at work. Was worried it wouldnt work with my phone without having to remove my otterbox defender case but works perfectly. Totally recommend! Might buy another soon if i have no issues in the future.

data.title: I wish I could do 4.5 stars
data.body:
I've gone back and forth on my opinion of this charger. It does a great job of charging my Samsung Galaxy 23 Ultra quickly, and it charges my Samsung watch quickly, as well. My one complaint is that it feels cheap. To me that means it is too light. It does not mean it IS poor quality, it just feels like it is, which is why I would give it a 4.5. The pro to this is it is better for travel being light. I just would like a bit more heft.

You do still need to find the right spot to start the charging on your phone, but I am happy that the "sweet spot" is easier to find than on the round chargers. I only missed the mark once and it didn't charge one night.

PROs:
*Fast charging as advertised
*Lights indicating charging status are useful

CON:
*Feels too light for me, so I question the quality (it's a nit that might be unfair)

data.title: Good charger
data.body: I decided that I'm tired of wearing out USB plugs and ports, and decided to upgrade to a wireless charger when I moved to the Galaxy S24 Ultra. The phone is in a Spigen Magfit case, and it works well with this charger, barely getting warm to the touch thanks to the built-in fan. It sure beats gambling on no-name imported chargers!

data.title: I'll keep it
data.body: It's a good charger. It doesn't charge my galaxy ear buds but it charges my phone and my galaxy watch. Sometimes if you don't place your phone on their Accurately it won't charge. Overall I'm keeping it

data.title: Good charger
data.body: This is a good charger all around. I like that I can charge my phone and my watch at the same time. My watch charges pretty quickly, but my phone seems to take a while, even when it's on the charger by itself. The fan can get kind of noisy and distracting when it's charging, but other than that I've had no problems.

data.title: Pretty good product
data.body: Pretty good product, I bought 2 of these. Have to take off a star because of them tend to make a popping/crackling sound from what I believe is the plastic deforming when it heats up and cools down. It happens at night and wakes both my wife and I up at times. Otherwise great performance, and size, lots of positions, and the BEST PART is the MAGNETIC watch charger!

data.title: Gamechanger
data.body:
My charge plug on my Galaxy phone stopped working, probably because I charge it every day.
Rather than fixing the phone I bought this charger instead.
One of the best purchases I've made in years. Should have bought one years ago.
I leave the charger base plugged in and when I need a charge I simply lay it on the surface and within about an hour my phone is fully charged even if it's down to 20%.
Highly recommend.

data.title: Great for charging
data.body: This is a convenitent way to charge ear buds or phones. If you have a case on your phone it has to be removed to use this pad

data.title: One side is for phone charge the other is for watch and earphone charge
data.body: I sorta like it, i thought both sides were able to charge a phone. Reason I purchased this. But soon i found out one side is strictly for phone charging and the other side for watch and earphone charge only. But it does the job.

data.title: Surprisingly useful and convenient
data.body: This is just a nice little product to have and it makes the process of charging my phone and earbuds seamless. I have this sitting on my desk and it allows me to casually set my phone on it in the morning before I go to work. The phone charging pad component is very lenient meaning you don’t have to worry about putting your phone down in a bad position and it not charging, like I’ve seen with some other wireless chargers. The lower wattage component on the right is a bit smaller but also magnetic so it is similarly easy to just set your earbuds or watch down for charging. I do wish it was a bit heavier or the rubber feet a bit more resistant to give the charging pad a bit more stability but overall I am incredibly happy with this and it really has changed the way that I approach charging my devices for the better.

data.title: Just what I needed for my desk at work
data.body: I love that I can charge my phone and my watch at the same time. Super easy, just lay them both on there. Whether or not it charges "quickly" is relative, but while I'm sitting there working time goes slowly anyways so does it really matter how fast it is? Does not take up a lot of real estate on my desk either.

data.title: Works great!!
data.body: As soon as I received it I plugged it in and charged my phone. It was nearly dead. Completely charged in one hour!! Love it!!

data.title: Works
data.body: Works great. No instructions needed, just plug and go.

data.title: Fast! Love it!
data.body: I hated to spend the money but the pad, charger, and cable make the purchase worth it. My phone supposedly had moisture in the charging port. This does the trick and does it FAST!

data.title: Muy buen producto y Excelente material
data.body: Muy buen producto y Excelente material

data.title: Awesome!!!
data.body: This dual charger is great! Fast charging and convenient, I use it for my S22Ultra and my GPro earbuds. Love this device!

data.title: It's alright, verify if it will actually work with your devices
data.body:
I have a couple of devices that I'd like to wireless charge, including an S23+, so I picked up this Samsung dual wireless charger, It was also cheaper than the single one for some reason, so that's nice.
It's important to note, as usual with these devices, the max output is 15W, so if you're occupying both spaces, each device wont get the full 15W charge. Pretty normal but a bit disappointing nonetheless.
Some people seem to like it for travel, its definitely really slim so it shouldn't be difficult to take it somewhere but it might be easier to just take a wired charger.

I am having some issues though, I don't know if my unit is faulty or if its some compatibility issue (which shouldn't happen regardless).
First, the led has never indicated a full charge (green) it's always red for me.
Next, I don't have a galaxy watch or buds, I use a different smart watch and earbuds, and the space where you'd normally put those devices (the right charger) doesn't work, it won't charge my phone (maybe the output is too low?) nor will it charge my earbuds and will indicate a charging issue after a few minutes. Was it designed to only work with galaxy devices, if so why? It might just be defective, either way I have no way to test this but it was a bit disappointing as I was hoping to occupy both spaces to charge my devices overnight, and the product info I don't believe specifies that it will only work with a galaxy watch and earbuds.
So basically I can only use the left charge space and the led light will just always glow red :).
exelente producto, conincide con las carateristicas indicadas, buen material.

data.title: Faster phone and watch charger!
data.body: Bought this to upgrade my old version that was 9w wireless charger for this 15w wireless charger for faster wireless charging for my Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra and Galaxy Watch 6 Classic. It could charge my phone and watch to full battery in less than 2 hours top.

data.title: Durability
data.body: After doing a lot of research this charger has been the best for me. I use this every night. It has helped with the longevity of the battery and doesn't overcharge the phone like a typical plug in charger. Increasing the battery life.

data.title: Nice
data.body: Really love this cgmharger! Great if you have a smartwatch!! Amazon has really good deals.

data.title: Nice
data.body: Good

data.title: Charge it!
data.body: I purchased this the same time I bought my new Folding phone and my new watch. You can charge 2 things at the same time, so it works perfectly with my new toys. As Martha would say "It's a good thing!".

data.title: Works wigh Samsung and Pixel phones
data.body: Works well and stable with S22 Ultra, Pixel 4, Pixel 6, Pixel 8, Samsung buds

data.title: fast charging
data.body: my only issue with this is sometimes getting my phone to charge when i lay it perpendicular. easily solved by laying the phone down parallel to the charger as i mostly only use it to charge my phone and watch

data.title: Charges Quickly
data.body: we purchased the charger for our 2 new Galaxy S24 phones and it charges them quickly

data.title: Charges multiple items at once
data.body: I love that it's sleek and flat. I love that I can charge my phone, earbuds and watch all in one spot. One of my favorite things I've bought that I use ever day. Samsung normally never let's you down.

data.title: Samsung quality.High quality
data.body:
It’s almost a month since I bought this.
It is working as described.
The price to quality trade off is a great attraction.
This charges my S23 ultra and Galaxy watch and
Galaxy buds 2 pro as described.No hassels.

data.title: Great buy.
data.body: I like how easy and convinient this product is to use.

data.title: Does what it's supposed to do!
data.body: Pricey but super convenient for charging a Samsung phone and watch.

data.title: Great charger
data.body: Very easy to use.

data.title: Great charger for travel or home for two devices!
data.body: I bought this because I had gotten a new smart watch of Samsung. Since the one they provide is hard to deal with I saw this one as a must. It charges very well (as long as it is aligned). Fast charger for both phone and watch. Easy for traveling! I used this on a trip and easy plug and charge. Being flat it was easy to pack. The cord is long enough. I have also used this for two phones. I have no idea why they don't sell these in the stores.

data.title: Fast wireless charger
data.body: Love my wireless charger can charge 2 devices at the same time quickly. I have a Samsung S23 ultra and can charge a phone fully in about an hour hour and a half. My samsung buds magnetically connect to one side of the pad as it charges. It has indicators that show a device is charging and when it's fully charged. The only downside is 3rd party earbuds I have only charge on one side of the pad and not the other but it's not a deal breaker.

data.title: Great fast wireless charging option
data.body: I finally decided to get the wireless charger for my phone and I am glad I did. It has a built in fan that helps to keep the phone from getting too warm when charging and IS a fast charge.

data.title: Charges anything Samsung.
data.body: Bought it for my wife. She has the earbuds, watch and phone. This charges 2 of them at a time. Works perfect

data.title: Nice upgrade to my old Samsung wireless charger
data.body: This fast charges my S24 Ultra with an Otterbox case. Nice to also be able to charge my earbuds at the same time. A lot more convenient than having to carry multiple chargers or waiting for one to finish charging and then charging the other if I only remembered to bring one charger.

data.title: Great wireless charging station
data.body: Purchased two of these, one for my Galaxy S21, Galaxy Watch6 and Galaxy Pro Buds2 and one for my wife's Galaxy S10, Galaxy Watch3 and Galaxy Pro Buds2. All of the devices charge quickly. The charging lights show which device is charging (red) or charged (green) for each section where a device is placed to charge. This is also great for traveling, easily fits in a bag. Our previous charging station had the vertical stand for the phone which made it awkward when packing it a bag, but these are completely flat and much easier to transport.

data.title: fast charger
data.body: works great! love not having to wear out my USBC port. charges my phone and watch at the same time with no issues.

data.title: EASY TO USE
data.body: Love this charger. Fast charge, easy just lay phone on & it charges.

data.title: Reason I bought this
data.body: While I was traveling in Europe in May, suddenly I have problems with charging my IPad, Samsung galaxy phone, IPad was solved in the Apple Store Paris, Samsung was the problem to find store, went to fix by repair shop, it happened again after I came back in September . As you know how bad samsung service call department, I decide to buy wireless charger, as lots of people said slow charge otherwise it is good. I paid €70 to fix my 6 month old Samsung phone. Even I am not sure Samsung would pay or fix free since I repaired unauthorized person in Amsterdam when it happened again in September. With headache to talk Samsung service department, Samsung said how about upgrade with pay little bit more for a new phone, that is not right way to a suggestion for less than 1 year old phone. Anyway I can’t charge my phone with cord charge anymore.

data.title: Must buy if you are in the Samsung ecosystem!
data.body: Charges my S24 Ultra, S21FE work phone and my Watch 4 simultaneously with no problems. Not so with many other wireless chargers. Should've bought this in the beginning.

data.title: Saves your battery!
data.body: Works as it should, now I can charge my things through out the night without harming the battery so it holds charges srongly, down side is the picky placements but hardly an issue. Strongly reccomend getting this product!

data.title: Works.
data.body: Its works. Works with even phone cases on. Good deal.

data.title: New Watch
data.body: Wife loves this product! However she has to take the straps off her watch to charge it. Small set back but still works great.

data.title: Works great
data.body: Works a lot better than the generic brands, well worth the extra money. Charges fast!

data.title: Charge your phone and watch at same time
data.body: I love this charger! I like having a wireless charger. It says my port.

data.title: Quick Wireless Charging
data.body: Works great on my old Samsung phone that wouldn’t charge on off brand chargers. Saved me from having to buy a new phone.

data.title: Very convenient!
data.body: The phone charging pad is not MagSafe compatible.
